objective.title: üéØ Objective
objective.description: The Swami Vivekananda Merit-cum-Means Scholarship aims to support meritorious but economically weaker students of West Bengal so they can continue higher education without financial burden.

fresh_application.title: ‚úÖ Eligibility ‚Äì Fresh Application
criteria: Academic Requirement: Minimum 60% marks in the last qualifying examination
Board / Institution: Passed from WBCHSE / Madrasa Board / AICTE-approved institutes
Diploma Holders: Minimum 60% marks (for Lateral Entry ‚Äì 2nd year Engineering)
Year Condition: Must pass and take admission in the current academic year
Domicile: Applicant must be a resident of West Bengal
fresh_application.income_exception_note: Income limit is NOT applicable for: Board Toppers, Kanyashree (K3) applicants, M.Phil & Ph.D students

renewal_application.title: üîÅ Eligibility ‚Äì Renewal
criteria: Must be promoted to the next academic year
Must maintain minimum 60% aggregate marks in previous year
Exams should generally be cleared in first attempt
Scholarship must have been approved in the previous year

scholarship_amount.title: üí∞ Scholarship Amount (Indicative)
scholarship_amount.note: Amount varies based on course & level. Paid yearly through DBT.

documents_required.title: üìÑ Required Documents
list: Marksheet of last qualifying examination (both sides)
Family Income Certificate (Not required for Kanyashree applicants)

documents_required.special_case: Year Gap: Declaration from Head of Institution required if qualifying year ‚â† current year

important_rules: Only ONE scholarship can be availed at a time
Cannot receive any other Government scholarship for the same course
One-time grants or institutional fee waivers are allowed
False information may lead to cancellation & recovery
